Package software.leonov.common.io

Class Zip

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.common.io.Zip
  • public final class Zip
extends Object
    Static utility methods useful for working with ZipFiles and ZipOutputStreams.

    This class is provided as a convenience to developers who are making casual use of the java.util.zip package. Consider using a dedicated 3rd party library such as Apache Commons Compress in production projects.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public static void close​(ZipFile zip,
                         boolean hideIOException)
                  throws IOException
        Deprecated.
        Java 7+ users should switch to try-with-resources or Guava's Closeables.close(Closeable, boolean) instead.
        Closes the specified ZipFile, with control over whether an IOException may be thrown. If the ZIP file is null it is ignored. This is primarily useful in a finally block, where a thrown exception needs to be logged but not propagated to the caller (otherwise the original exception will be lost).

        If an IOException occurs and hideIOException is true it will be logged but never thrown. Otherwise it will be propagated to the caller.

        Parameters:
        zip - the specified ZIP file
        hideIOException - whether or not propagate IOExceptions
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs and hideIOException is false

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly​(ZipFile zip)
        Deprecated.
        Java 7+ users should switch to try-with-resources or Guava's Closeables.close(Closeable, boolean) instead.
        Closes the specified ZipFile, logging and swallowing any IOExceptions. If the ZIP file is null it is ignored.

        Warning: this method is prone to misuse. In general IOExceptions should be handled and/or propagated to the caller when closing a resource. Use this method only if you sure that no other action can be taken if an IOException occurs.

        Parameters:
        zip - the specified ZIP file

      • getEntries

        public static Iterator<? extends ZipEntry> getEntries​(ZipFile zip)
        Deprecated.
        Java 8+ users should prefer ZipFile.stream(). If an Iterator is required users can call Stream.iterator().
        Returns all the entries in the specified ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        zip - the specified ZIP file
        Returns:
        all the entries in the specified ZIP file

      • getEntries

        public static Iterator<? extends ZipEntry> getEntries​(ZipFile zip,
                                                      Predicate<? super ZipEntry> filter)
        Deprecated.
        Java 8+ users should prefer ZipFile.stream().filter(Predicate). If an Iterator is required users can call Stream.iterator().
        Returns all the entries in the specified ZIP file that match the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        zip - the specified ZIP file
        filter - the given predicate
        Returns:
        all the entries in the specified ZIP file that match the given predicate

      • isDirectory

        public static Predicate<ZipEntry> isDirectory()
        Returns a predicate which tests if a ZipEntry is a directory.

        Note: This method returns an instance of com.google.common.base.Predicate (which extends java.util.function.Predicate) for backwards compatibility. Java 8+ users should reference java.util.function.Predicate directly.

        For example: java.util.function.Predicate<ZipEntry> filter = Zip.isDirectory();

        Returns:
        a predicate which tests if a ZipEntry is a directory

      • isFile

        public static Predicate<ZipEntry> isFile()
        Returns a predicate which tests if a ZipEntry is not a directory.

        Note: This method returns an instance of com.google.common.base.Predicate (which extends java.util.function.Predicate) for backwards compatibility. Java 8+ users should reference java.util.function.Predicate directly.

        For example: java.util.function.Predicate<ZipEntry> filter = Zip.isFile();

        Returns:
        a predicate which tests if a ZipEntry is not a directory

      • newZipInputStream

        public static ZipInputStream newZipInputStream​(Path path)
                                        throws IOException
        Returns a ZIP input stream to given file using the UTF-8 charset to decode ZIP entry names. The charset is ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set.
        Parameters:
        path - the given file
        Returns:
        a ZIP input stream to given file using the UTF-8 charset to decode ZIP entry names
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • newZipInputStream

        public static ZipInputStream newZipInputStream​(Path path,
                                               Charset charset)
                                        throws IOException
        Returns a ZIP input stream to given file using the specified charset to decode ZIP entry names. The charset is ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set.
        Parameters:
        path - the given file
        charset - the charset to use to decode the ZIP entry names (ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set)
        Returns:
        a ZIP input stream to given file using the specified charset to decode ZIP entry names
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • putNextEntry

        public static ZipOutputStream putNextEntry​(ZipOutputStream zout,
                                           ZipEntry ze,
                                           byte[] bytes)
                                    throws IOException
        Writes a new ZIP entry and positions the stream for writing the next entry.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the ZIP entry is a directory and the bytes array is not null.

        Note: The directory structure of a ZIP file is inferred from the path of each constituent file. It is not necessary to create directory entries when writing a ZIP file unless you wish to create an empty directory.

        Parameters:
        zout - the ZipOutputStream
        ze - the ZipEntry
        bytes - the contents of the ZipEntry or null if the ZipEntry is a directory
        Returns:
        the ZipOutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified entry is a directory and the bytes array is not null

      • read

        public static String read​(ZipFile zip,
                          ZipEntry ze)
                   throws IOException
        Returns a string containing all the characters from the given ZIP entry in the UTF-8 charset.
        Parameters:
        zip - the ZIP file in which to find the ZIP entry
        ze - the given ZIP entry
        Returns:
        a string containing all the characters from the given ZIP entry in the UTF-8 charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified entry is a directory
        See Also:
        Charsets

                          ZipEntry ze,
                          Charset charset)
                   throws IOException
        Returns a string containing all the characters from the given ZIP entry in the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        zip - the ZIP file in which to find the ZIP entry
        ze - the given ZIP entry
        charset - the character set to use when reading the ZIP entry
        Returns:
        a string containing all the characters from the given ZIP entry in the specified charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified entry is a directory
        See Also:
        Charsets

      • readLines

        public static List<String> readLines​(ZipFile zip,
                                     ZipEntry ze)
                              throws IOException
        Returns all of the lines read from the specified ZIP entry using the UTF-8 charset. The lines do not include line-termination characters, but do include other leading and trailing whitespace.
        Parameters:
        zip - the ZIP file in which to find the ZIP entry
        ze - the specified ZIP entry
        Returns:
        a mutable List containing all the lines read from a ZIP entry using the UTF-8 charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified entry is a directory

      • readLines

        public static List<String> readLines​(ZipFile zip,
                                     ZipEntry ze,
                                     Charset charset)
                              throws IOException
        Returns all of the lines read from the specified ZIP entry using the specified charset. The lines do not include line-termination characters, but do include other leading and trailing whitespace.
        Parameters:
        zip - the ZIP file in which to find the ZIP entry
        ze - the specified ZIP entry
        charset - the charset used to decode the ZIP entry
        Returns:
        a mutable List containing all the lines read from a ZIP entry using the specified charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified entry is a directory

      • unzip

        public static Path unzip​(Path zip,
                         Path dest)
                  throws IOException
        Extracts the given ZIP file to the destination directory using the UTF-8 charset to decode ZIP entry names. The charset is ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set.

        Password protected ZIP files are not supported. If the destination directory does not exist this call will result in an IllegalArgumentException. If the ZIP file contains entries outside the destination directory a ZipException will be thrown. If the destination directory is a symbolic link it will be resolved to its final target. ZIP entries representing symbolic links are not supported. Existing files will be overwritten.

        Note: If this operation fails because of an I/O error or other problems it may have succeeded in extracting some (but not all) of the files and/or directories.

        Parameters:
        zip - the given ZIP file
        dest - the destination directory
        Returns:
        the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • unzip

        public static Path unzip​(Path zip,
                         Path dest,
                         Charset charset)
                  throws IOException
        Extracts the given ZIP file to the destination directory using the specified charset to decode ZIP entry names. The charset is ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set.

        Password protected ZIP files are not supported. If the destination directory does not exist this call will result in an IllegalArgumentException. If the ZIP file contains entries outside the destination directory a ZipException will be thrown. If the destination directory is a symbolic link it will be resolved to its final target. ZIP entries representing symbolic links are not supported. Existing files will be overwritten.

        Note: If this operation fails because of an I/O error or other problems it may have succeeded in extracting some (but not all) of the files and/or directories.

        Parameters:
        zip - the given ZIP file
        dest - the destination directory
        charset - the charset to use to decode the ZIP entry names (ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set)
        Returns:
        the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        ZipException - if a ZIP entry falls outside the destination directory (for example if the ZIP file is created using absolute pathnames)

      • unzip

        public static Path unzip​(Path zip,
                         Predicate<ZipEntry> filter,
                         Path dest,
                         Charset charset)
                  throws IOException
        Extracts the given ZIP file to the destination directory using the given Predicate to filter ZIP entries and the specified charset to decode ZIP entry names. The charset is ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set.

        Password protected ZIP files are not supported. If the destination directory does not exist this call will result in an IllegalArgumentException. If the ZIP file contains entries outside the destination directory a ZipException will be thrown. If the destination directory is a symbolic link it will be resolved to its final target. ZIP entries representing symbolic links are not supported. Existing files will be overwritten.

        Note: If this operation fails because of an I/O error or other problems it may have succeeded in extracting some (but not all) of the files and/or directories.

        Parameters:
        zip - the given ZIP file
        filter - the predicate to use to filter ZIP entries
        dest - the destination directory
        charset - the charset to use to decode the ZIP entry names (ignored if the language encoding bit of the ZIP entry's general purpose bit flag is set)
        Returns:
        the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        ZipException - if a ZIP entry falls outside the destination directory (for example if the ZIP file is created using absolute pathnames)
